parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and didomi; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. Deal out; also to deliver over.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From kata; and hos and tis; according to which certain thing, i.e. As far as.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
